---


NOTE: This is one of the very first handful of so-called "ultra-hi-def" releases.

I'll be using the "[uHD]" prefix to label them and make them readily locatable, for as long as they continue to be rarities, in addition to the usual dpi resolution figure following the "Digital" source tag.

I do not know if the release groups have come to some sort of formal agreement on the watershed resolution between "ordinary" and "ultra" hi-def, but at least within Empire the releasers seem to have agreed on the "uHD" tag itself. Based on past experience and this first wave of thusly-tagged rips, anything below 400 dpi (2,560 pixels wide, at standard aspect ratio) is to be considered "ordinary" and anything above 450 dpi (~3k pixels wide at standard AR) "ultra".

Enjoy! :D
